text: Chernihiv Oblast is subdivided into districts (raions) and city municipalities (mis'krada or misto), officially known as territories governed by city councils. In parallel, it is subdivided into amalgamated territorial communities (hromadas). ==Administrative divisions after 2020== Raions of Chernihiv Oblast as of August 2020. As of July 2020, the number of districts is in the process of being reduced to five. These are: # Chernihiv (Чернігівський район), the center is in the city of Chernihiv; # Koriukivka (Корюківський район), the center is in the town of Koriukivka; # Nizhyn (Ніжинський район), the center is in the town of Nizhyn; # Novhorod-Siverskyi (Новгород-Сіверський район), the center is in the town of Novhorod-Siverskyi; # Pryluky (Прилуцький район), the center is in the town of Pryluky. ==Administrative divisions until 2020== Raions of Chernihiv Oblast as of June 2020. The city of Chernihiv is shown in dark blue. In 2020, Chernihiv Oblast was subdivided into 26 regions: 22 districts (raions) and 4 city municipalities (mis'krada or misto), officially known as territories governed by city councils. *Cities under the oblast's jurisdiction: **Chernihiv (Чернігів), the administrative center of the oblast **Nizhyn (Ніжин) **Novhorod-Siverskyi Municipality ***Cities and towns under the city's jurisdiction:
